definitions: a person or thing that makes something bad less severe, serious, or painful

examples.text: we're holding bonds as a mitigator of risk

shortDefinitions: person or thing that makes something bad less severe or painful

definitions: something that lessens the gravity of an offense or mistake

examples.text: the law lists a dozen mitigators, such as mental problems the defendant was suffering

shortDefinitions: something that lessens gravity of an offence or mistake
